meanings.definition: Comparative form of growth, meaning having more growth.
meanings.sent1: The plant looked growthier after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The tree in the backyard is growthier than the one in the front yard.
meanings.sent3: The growthier vines seemed to be reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her ambitions were growthier than the tallest skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The growthier leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Showing more growth than something else.
meanings.sent1: The growthier flowers attracted more bees.
meanings.sent2: The growthier branches blocked the sunlight from reaching the ground.
meanings.sent3: The growthier pumpkin in the patch was the envy of the garden.
meanings.sent4: His growthier ideas outshined all the others in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The growthier grass swayed in the wind, a sea of green waves.
